intro: Anthemis topaliana, commonly known as the Turkish tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves and yellow-orange ray flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The plant is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
